newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Varig cargo manager resigns after poor H1.
newsitem.headline: Varig cargo manager resigns after poor H1.

text.p: Brazil's Varig said its group cargo manager Andres Lautersztajn has resigned after the firm posted poor first half results, including a 23 percent drop in cargo volume.
A company spokesman said Lautersztajn was replaced immediately by Carlos Muniz, the head of Varig's cargo handling subdiairy, SATA.
Lautersztajn "asked to step down due to a series of reformulations the company will undertake as it aims to be more aggressive in the cargo market," the spokesman said.
On August 16, Varig reported a 154 million real first-half loss versus a loss of 112.5 million reais in the same period last year.
The spokesman said the firm also saw a 23 percent decline in cargo volume. Cargo usually accounts for 25 percent of Varig's revenue.
